reviews.review_msg: Professor Travers is passionate, knowledgable and considerate towards their students. They are always available to meet during any time, however, they expect you to read a heavy amount of material each week and lectures are all conversation based rather than notes.

She doesn't use or allow screens in her class, but she breaks the class up into groups and allows for study time with groups during class which really helps for understanding the material. I had a really positive experience and would recommend her in a heartbeat, but you definitely need to pay attention & take notes to pass.

Ann is an engaging lecturer & a fair marker. a decent amount of effort is required to do well in this class, but it's worth it because the material is interesting. one thing i didn't like was she was too opinionated. if you ever disagree with her, she will dislike it. she should present opposing arguments to what she thinks. a bit self-righteous

I found her to be very fair and democratic.  She is more than willing to discuss any concerns and welcomes any questions you may have. She also provided great feedback on my projects which has helped me in other classes as well.

Incredibly passionate about what she is teaching.But she is a bit controlling (ie. NEVER come into the class late, wait outside until there is a break), and she snapped at a few people who didn't deserve it, and a few who did...But if you are interested in the material, you will learn so much.
